oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Impacts of the Invasive : Lessons Learned from One of Europe's Top Invasive Species
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Coakley, Stephanie
Petti, Carloalberto
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: theme:invasion impact
theme:wikidata.org/entity/Q112148709
invasive species
invasion impact
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Biological invasions are renowned for their negative ecological and economic implications, however from studying invasions invaluable insights can be gained in the fields of ecology and evolution- potentially contributing towards conservation plans to deal, not only with biological invasion, but with other concerning issues, such as climate change. Impatiens glandulifera, or Himalayan balsam, is widely considered to be a highly problematic invasive, having spread across more than thirty countries during the past century. This paper will examine the findings which have arose from studying I. glandulifera and its impacts on the invaded ecosystem.
